instructions: On your Android phone or tablet, open the Google Play Store app . Tap Menu and then Play Pr otect . Look for information about the status of your device.
On your Android phone or tablet, open the Google Play Store app . Tap Menu and then Play Protect and then Settings . Turn Scan device for security threats on or off.
On your Android phone or tablet, open the Google Play Store app . Tap Menu and then Play Protect and then Settings . Turn Improve harmful app detection on or off.

Tap Settings , located on your iPhone's Home Screen. Tap Accessibility . Under Physical and Motor , tap Touch . On the following screen, tap AssistiveTouch so that it turns from white to green (off to on). Next, select Customize Top Level Menu . Tap the plus ( + ) button, located towards the bottom right-hand corner of the screen. A new icon with a plus symbol will now be added to this screen. Tap this button. A list of accessibility features should now appear. Scroll down and select the one labeled Screenshot , ensuring that it has a blue checkmark next to it. Tap Done , located in the upper right-hand corner of the screen. You should now see a Screenshot option added to your Top Level Menu. You'll notice that a grayish, circular button is overlaying your iPhone screen. Tap this new button at any time to open the AssistiveTouch interface. To capture the contents of your screen, simply tap the Screenshot icon. The new image will be instantly saved to your Camera Roll.

Return to the AssistiveTouch settings screen. Select the 3D Touch option, located under CUSTOM ACTIONS . A list of actions that can be tied to 3D Touch should now be displayed. Select the one labeled Screenshot , ensuring that it has a blue checkmark next to it. You can now take screenshots by just tapping and briefly holding the AssistiveTouch circular button, eliminating an extra tap in the process.
